title: Strictly Come Dancing Karim Zeroual falls ill days before live show
text:
Poor Karim Zeroual is under the weather (Picture: Instagram)

Strictly Come Dancing star Karim Zeroual missed an appearance on It Takes Two after falling ill.

The presenter and his dance partner Amy Dowden were unable to rehearse for their upcoming performance as poor Karim has ‘the lurgy’ as was explained on It Takes Two.

But she also expressed concern that they both have a lot of work to do to make sure they’re ready for their fierce tango on Saturday night.

She told host Zoe Ball: ‘He’s so disappointed not to be here. We’re a day down and he’s had a busy work schedule so we haven’t been able to put in hours.

‘We’ve still got a lot to do technically, and I’ve gotta try and get the smile off his face. Hopefully he’s feeling better and he can go for it.’

Zoe revealed on the show that Karim’s mum had rustled up some meatballs to help her son feel better, and handed the dish over to Amy to make sure Karim got them.

Karim is currently one of the favourites to lift the glitterball this year after some impressive performances.

Will he be fighting fit by Saturday? (Picture: PA)

After the second week of Strictly the pair topped the leaderboard with a fabulous 32 points for their foxtrot, getting some glowing feedback from the judges – particularly Shirley Ballas.

Not only that, Karim’s odds of lifting the glitterball trophy have been slashed, bringing him closer to the current favourite, Emmerdale actor Kelvin Fletcher.

Karim will have to stop being so smiley to put on a passionate tango with Amy this weekend.

Their routine will be to Paradise by George Ezra, which will hopefully give them a boost on the leaderboard after a disheartening score last week for their Kung Fu Panda inspired dance.

Amy said she tried not to pay too much attention to scoring and just make sure Karim enjoys himself.

She told Zoe: ‘I told him he did everything I asked of him. I thought he was a brilliant panda and this is the most incredible journey and all I want for him is to have fun and have the best time.

‘When we came off he said I had the best time out there and that’s all I want for him.’

Strictly Come Dancing airs Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.
